translation.title: A Saṅgha of a Thousand Nuns

segments.en: 11. A Saṅgha of a Thousand Nuns

segments.pli: Ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati rājakārāme.
segments.en: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in the Royal Monastery.

segments.pli: Atha kho sahassabhikkhunisaṃgho yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ aṭṭhāsi. Ekamantaṃ ṭhitā kho tā bhikkhuniyo bhagavā etadavoca:
segments.en: Then a Saṅgha of a thousand nuns went up to the Buddha, bowed, and stood to one side. The Buddha said to them:

segments.pli: “Catūhi kho, bhikkhuniyo, dhammehi samannāgato ariyasāvako sotāpanno hoti avinipātadhammo niyato sambodhiparāyaṇo.
segments.en: “Nuns, a noble disciple who has four things is a stream-enterer, not liable to be reborn in the underworld, bound for awakening.

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhuniyo, ariyasāvako buddhe aveccappasādena samannāgato hoti—
segments.en: It’s when a noble disciple has experiential confidence in the Buddha …

segments.pli: itipi so bhagavā … pe … satthā devamanussānaṃ buddho bhagavāti.
ariyakantehi sīlehi samannāgato hoti, akhaṇḍehi … pe … samādhisaṃvattanikehi.
segments.en: And they have the ethical conduct loved by the noble ones … leading to immersion.

segments.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhuniyo, catūhi dhammehi samannāgato ariyasāvako sotāpanno hoti avinipātadhammo niyato sambodhiparāyaṇo”ti.
segments.en: A noble disciple who has these four things is a stream-enterer, not liable to be reborn in the underworld, bound for awakening.”
